channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report I-2024030014
item.description:
Report I-2024030014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: Lynchburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Company Fuel Driver was making a fuel delivery at store at 09:03am, the driver had two hoses of connected from the trailer belly valves to the underground fuel storage tank(UST). Cones were in place to protect the area as well as lights activated for warnings. A white pickup truck(Super Duty) bearing Maryland registration# 9EC0549, pulling a - cement mixer trailer, disregarded the activated lights and orange security cones of our vehicle; drove over the hose fitting connected to the UST and tore the fitting and the lip of the UST off the tank. The hose attached to the trailer UST became stuck under the pickup truck. The driver exited their truck and removed the hose from under his truck; and left the scene immediately. Police report was filed with VA State Police(Trooper J.B. Moore) for truck"leaving th€ scene of the accident". Fuel driver managed to capture a photo of the truck that ran over the fitting and hoses and reported the incident to Law Enforcement and the Safety Department immediately. Material spilled was contained by the fuel driver using absorbent pads, and emptied the remaining fuel in the hose into the UST. No fuel contaminated the ground nor entered into any water systems.

item.title: Report E-2024020415
item.description:
Report E-2024020415

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/14/2024 at 1812, personnel in the CSXT Acca Yard reported UTLX 210839, a loaded tank car of Alcohols N.O.S., was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Valero Marketing, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-02-14-00201). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Blaise MacDonald, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, were dispatched to the scene and found the manway cover was mis-aligned allowing the release; additionally, seven out of eight manway cover bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel inspected the manway cover gasket and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Judy Watson 210-934-8157).

item.title: Report X-2024030038
item.description:
Report X-2024030038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE BLUE BELT FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING ON THE FLOOR. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE LEAKING FROM THE TOP OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER IDENTIFIED IT AS A CORROSIVE PACKAGE, CONTAINERIZED IT INTO A SPILL TRAY AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP ARE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024021898
item.description:
Report X-2024021898

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/7/2024 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4346935 at the station location in Hampton, reporting an undeclared fuel oil shipment. The package consisted of one glass bottle pacakged inside of a fiberboard box, identical to the package reported in Spill Incident # 3006. Further inspection revealed that the package was identical to the previously reported undeclared shipment. The package is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024021756
item.description:
Report X-2024021756

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: WINCHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking on the conveyor belt manager immediately notified HAZMAT trained employee. Package was isolated and taken to the building's HAZMAT inspection area. DescribePack: Improper packing of the material allowed for damage to occur to the inner containers which were crushed and caused leakage. One of the lids popped off as a result. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT trained employee immediately isolated the package in the HAZMAT inspection area. Package was placed in a HAZMAT bag to reduce further exposure.
